content: Are the system use information requirements displayed in the log-on banners before granting further access?

{'query': 'Are the system use information requirements displayed in the log-on banners before granting further access?', 'context': 'Question: System or Application will offer the ability to present a notification message to users upon login identifying the authorized usage of system or application (e.g. logon banner). | Answer: Fully Supported | Details: Not Supported or on roadmap | Category: Application', 'text': 'The display of system use information requirements in log-on banners is not supported.\n\n(Note: The original response was already in paragraph form, so no formatting changes were necessary.)'}
Does the organization have processes and mechanisms for restricting access to system components and cardholder data that are defined and understood?
Personal data is pseudonymised as soon as possible

Does the organization have dynamic access management techniques to protect information throughout its life cycle?

{'query': 'Does the organization have dynamic access management techniques to protect information throughout its life cycle?', 'context': 'Question: Does the organization use the following to protect controlled network access to IT resources?  Please describe.', 'text': 'The organization uses Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) to protect controlled network access to IT resources. MFA ensures that only authorized users can access sensitive systems, while RBAC restricts user access based on their assigned roles within the organization.\n\n The organization utilizes a risk-based approach to its dynamic access management techniques, which include the use of identity and access management (IAM) tools and systems to protect information throughout its life cycle. These IAM systems monitor user behavior and activities in real-time, granting or revoking access based on predefined policies and controls. This proactive approach helps prevent unauthorized access and ensures that sensitive data remains secure across all stages of its lifecycle, from creation to disposal.'}
Do your company restrict administrative access to desktops to employees and third parties?

{'query': 'Do your company restrict administrative access to desktops to employees and third parties?', 'context': 'Question: Does the company restrict administrative access to desktops, laptops and PDAs to employees and third parties? | Answer: Yes | Details: Furthermore, Danfe Corp does not store customer data on our office computers or removable media.\nCustomer data is stored only in our production environment. Additionally, the Operations team uses dedicated computers for accessing the production environment; these computers have strict policies on what software can be installed. To access the production environment via SSH, two-factor authentication is enforced by a bastion host where one authentication factor is a per-user password-encrypted RSA-2048 SSH key, which can be individually disabled, and the other factor is a time-based one-time password. | Category: Information Security', 'text': 'Yes, the company restricts administrative access to desktops to employees and third parties. Furthermore, Danfe Corp does not store customer data on our office computers or removable media. Customer data is stored only in our production environment. Additionally, the Operations team uses dedicated computers for accessing the production environment; these computers have strict policies on what software can be installed. To access the production environment via SSH, two-factor authentication is enforced by a bastion host where one authentication factor is a per-user password-encrypted RSA-2048 SSH key, which can be individually disabled, and the other factor is a time-based one-time password.'}
